channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Urine and faeces in communal areas, 9th September
item.description:
Urine and faeces on the staircase leading to apartments. All communal areas are dirty and have not been cleaned for the past two weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London

item.title: Communal bins, 9th September
item.description:
The recycling bins are overflowing One of the communal waste bins (black) has commercial waste in it - it is extremely heavy, unable to be moved. Blocking access to the other black (communal) bins
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownswood Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 9th September

item.title: Bees nest, 9th September
item.description:
Has been reported to school and parents have been made aware, but there is a very large bees nest located inside the honeysuckle hanging over the fence. The base of the plant is on council property so please can you come out and make this area safe as children have to pass it daily to get into school. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Doveney Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old bedding etc dumped on the pavement in Maple Crescent near corner of Wellington Avenue just past 2 Maple Crescent., 9th September
item.description:
This bedding is now being pulled apart by foxes and used by them as a toilet. It is becoming a health hazard. Please could this be removed ASAP. Thank you..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A resident called to advise that someone has dumped a few household items (rubbish) infront of their front garden and the items look horrible. She says that this consisted of 2 drawers, a mattress and a Wardrobe, 9th September
item.description:
A resident called to inform the office that someone has dumped some over used items in their front garden and this consisted of 2 drawers, a Mattress and wardrobe.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Containers abandoned / dumped ?, 9th September
item.description:
These plastic containers were scattered across the area - we have stacked them to minimise the problem. I believe they are Ocado as the vans frequently stop on these yellow lines to sort out their deliveries. Probably not left intentionally but I donâ€™t know how to contact Ocado
